seo.title: Wood Fence Installation Wilmington NC | Privacy & Custom Wood Fencing
seo.description: Professional wood fence installation in Wilmington, Leland & Hampstead NC. Board-on-board, cap & trim, stockade styles. 5-year warranty. Free quotes!

hero.title: Wood Fences
hero.headline: Beautiful Wood Fence Installation in Wilmington
hero.description: Nothing beats the natural warmth and timeless appeal of a wood fence. At Flytrap Fence Company, we specialize in crafting custom wood fences that enhance your property's beauty while providing the privacy and security your family deserves. From classic board-on-board privacy fences to elegant cap and trim designs, we build fences that stand the test of time.

benefits.title: Why Wilmington Homeowners Choose Wood Fences

items.title: Natural Beauty
items.description: Wood fences offer unmatched aesthetic appeal that complements any architectural style. The natural grain patterns and warm tones of cedar and pressure-treated pine create a welcoming atmosphere that vinyl and metal simply can't replicate.

items.title: Complete Privacy
items.description: Our board-on-board and solid panel designs provide true privacy with no gaps between boards. Perfect for creating a secluded backyard oasis where you can relax, entertain, and let kids and pets play safely.

items.title: Customizable Design
items.description: Wood is the most versatile fencing material available. We can build any height, style, or configuration you need—including curved sections, custom gates, lattice tops, and decorative post caps to match your vision.

items.title: Cost-Effective Investment
items.description: Wood fencing offers excellent value for Wilmington homeowners. You get premium aesthetics and functionality at a lower initial cost than vinyl or aluminum, with easy repair options if damage occurs.

items.title: Eco-Friendly Choice
items.description: Wood is a renewable, biodegradable material with a lower carbon footprint than manufactured alternatives. Our pressure-treated lumber comes from sustainable forestry operations.

items.title: Increases Property Value
items.description: A quality wood fence is one of the best investments for your home. Real estate studies show that fencing can increase property values by 10-15%, and wood fences consistently rank as buyer favorites.

styles.title: Wood Fence Styles We Install
styles.description: Every property is unique, and we offer a full range of wood fence styles to match your needs and preferences. Here are the most popular options for Wilmington-area homes:

items.name: Board-on-Board Privacy
items.description: Our most popular style for backyard privacy. Overlapping vertical boards on alternating sides of the rails create a fence with no gaps visible from either side. This design looks great from both your yard and your neighbor's, and allows airflow while blocking views completely.

items.name: Cap & Trim (Capped Board)
items.description: The premium choice for homeowners who want that extra touch of elegance. Features a horizontal cap rail on top and trim pieces that frame the fence beautifully. This style adds architectural interest and gives your fence a polished, finished look that stands out in any neighborhood.

items.name: Stockade (Dog-Ear)
items.description: A classic, economical choice that delivers solid privacy at an affordable price. Features tightly-spaced vertical pickets with dog-ear (pointed) tops. This straightforward design has been a neighborhood staple for decades and remains popular for good reason—it works.

items.name: Horizontal Slat (Modern)
items.description: Contemporary horizontal board design that's become increasingly popular in Wilmington's newer developments. The clean, linear look pairs perfectly with modern and transitional architecture. Available with varying gap widths from complete privacy to semi-private.

items.name: Shadowbox (Good Neighbor)
items.description: Alternating boards on opposite sides of the rails create a fence that looks identical from both sides—perfect when you want to be a good neighbor. The staggered design provides partial privacy while allowing air circulation and light through.

items.name: Picket Fence
items.description: The quintessential American fence style. Our picket fences define property boundaries with charm and character while maintaining an open, welcoming feel. Available in various picket styles from traditional pointed to flat-top and decorative.

steps.title: Free On-Site Consultation
steps.description: We visit your property to discuss your goals, assess the terrain, identify any underground utilities, and take precise measurements. You'll get expert recommendations based on your needs, local codes, and budget.

steps.title: Custom Quote & Design
steps.description: Within 48 hours, you receive a detailed written quote with material specifications, style options, and a clear timeline. No hidden fees, no surprises—just transparent pricing you can count on.

steps.title: Material Selection & Ordering
steps.description: We source premium pressure-treated pine or cedar from trusted regional suppliers. All lumber is hand-selected for straightness and quality before it arrives at your property.

steps.title: Property Preparation
steps.description: Before installation day, we mark all utility lines and property boundaries. We'll also obtain any necessary permits from New Hanover, Brunswick, or Pender County on your behalf.

steps.title: Professional Installation
steps.description: Our experienced crew arrives on schedule with all materials and equipment. We set posts in concrete at proper depths (typically 1/3 of total post length), ensure everything is level and plumb, and build your fence to last.

steps.title: Final Walkthrough & Warranty
steps.description: We walk the completed fence with you to ensure every detail meets your expectations. You receive your 5-year workmanship warranty documentation and care instructions for maximum fence longevity.

items.question: How long does a wood fence last in Wilmington's coastal climate?
items.answer: With proper installation and maintenance, a pressure-treated wood fence in the Wilmington area typically lasts 15-20 years. Our installation techniques—including deep concrete post settings and elevated bottom rails—help protect against the moisture and humidity common in coastal North Carolina. Cedar fences can last even longer, often 20-25 years, due to their natural rot resistance.

items.question: What type of wood do you recommend for fences in the Wilmington area?
items.answer: We primarily use pressure-treated Southern Yellow Pine for its excellent durability and value in our coastal climate. The treatment process protects against rot, insects, and fungal decay. For customers seeking premium aesthetics and natural rot resistance, we also offer Western Red Cedar, which weathers to a beautiful silver-gray patina over time.

items.question: Do I need to seal or stain my new wood fence?
items.answer: We recommend waiting 3-6 months after installation to allow the wood to dry and cure properly before applying any sealant or stain. After that initial period, applying a quality water-repellent sealant or semi-transparent stain every 2-3 years will significantly extend your fence's lifespan and maintain its appearance. We're happy to provide product recommendations.

items.question: How tall can I build my wood fence in Wilmington?
items.answer: Most residential areas in Wilmington, Leland, and Hampstead allow 6-foot fences in backyards and 4-foot fences in front yards without special permits. However, regulations vary by municipality and HOA. During our consultation, we'll verify the specific requirements for your property and handle any necessary permitting.

items.question: What's the difference between board-on-board and a regular privacy fence?
items.answer: A standard privacy fence (stockade style) has pickets nailed to one side of the rails, leaving the rail structure visible from the opposite side. Board-on-board fencing alternates pickets on both sides of the rails, eliminating gaps and creating a finished appearance from both directions. It costs slightly more but provides better privacy and a more attractive 'good neighbor' look.

items.question: How long does wood fence installation take?
items.answer: Most residential wood fence installations take 1-3 days depending on the total linear footage and complexity. A typical 150-200 linear foot backyard fence is usually completed in 1-2 days. We'll provide a specific timeline during your quote consultation.

items.question: Can you install a wood fence on sloped or uneven ground?
items.answer: Absolutely. We have extensive experience installing fences on the varied terrain throughout the Wilmington area. For slopes, we can either 'rack' the fence (angling each section to follow the grade) or 'step' it (creating level sections that stair-step down the slope). We'll recommend the best approach for your specific property during the consultation.

items.question: What's included in your 5-year workmanship warranty?
items.answer: Our warranty covers defects in installation workmanship including post failure, leaning sections, gate operation issues, and structural problems not caused by external damage or neglect. If any issue arises from our installation work within 5 years, we'll repair it at no cost to you. This warranty is transferable if you sell your home.

pricing.title: Wood Fence Pricing in Wilmington
pricing.description: Wood fence pricing varies based on style, height, wood species, and terrain complexity. Stockade-style privacy fences start around $28/linear foot, while premium board-on-board and cap & trim designs range from $38-$55/linear foot. We provide detailed, itemized quotes so you know exactly what you're paying for—no hidden fees or surprise charges.
includes: Concrete post setting for maximum stability

cta.headline: Ready for Your New Wood Fence?
cta.description: Get a free, no-obligation quote for professional wood fence installation in Wilmington, Leland, Hampstead, or anywhere in the Cape Fear region. Most quotes are delivered within 48 hours of your consultation.
